description: Crews & Tangos, Toronto‚Äôs #1 Drag Bar, is located in the heart of the Church-Wellesley Gay Village. We have become a community staple and top party destination, encouraging a safe and welcoming environment where patrons can be themselves! Re-Opened in 2010 under New Management, Crews & Tangos strives to create a one of a kind party atmosphere with nightly main stage drag performance seven days a week, dancing Thursday-Saturday, and big screen karaoke every Thursday! With the largest and highest prize amounts in the city, Crews & Tangos provides opportunities for career & talent development for drag performers of every genre through the Miss Crews & Tangos Pageant and Crews & Tangos Drag Race every summer. With several major annual events throughout the year, including our Halloween extravaganza ‚ÄòHallomania‚Äô, you can always expect the most over the top drag performances and productions in Toronto. Join the party at Crews & Tangos, and check out our nightly events page by clicking he

reviews.title: Hot. Sooooo hot!
text: No improvements necessary sexy wonderful place. Soooooo gay so friendly and sexy 3ceryone in tge building.

reviews.title: Fun!
text: Excellent atmosphere & performers! We had a great time in this safe space. Just be aware it was a cash only bar & cash cover!

reviews.title: Average fun
text: The most fun you can have if you are gay in the village (with your clothes on üòâ) and the BEST music. Also come for the best night of all

reviews.title: COVID May have ruined this place
text: This was probably a fun spot pre-COVID, but we were a group of seven that went last night and I probably won‚Äôt be back.  $10 cover and $45 for a pitcher of sangria.  Cash only.  Mandatory 20% tip and a requirement to settle your bill with every drink purchase.  Entry and a round of drinks was $240!  With a two hour sitting limit (though the place was empty).  The vibe was dull (though the Queens did their absolute best to hype up the tiny crowd).  It just all felt forced and NOT worth it.  The waitress was almost impossible to find and failed to share all the specials which resulted in us being over charged For shots.  Then they said they would move us to the street because they needed the table for the next group.  When we were ready to move, they didn‚Äôt have a space for us on the street.  So we went somewhere else.  I get that places need to charge more to re-coup losses, but I need to see some value for my investment and this just felt like a huge cash grab.  Not remotely comparable to any place we‚Äôve visited post-COVID and in my opinion, not worth it.

reviews.title: Entertaining and Welcoming
text: First time visiting and found the environment friendly, and the entertainment was fabulous. Drinks were reasonably priced. All staff were helpful and professional. Thank you!

reviews.title: Style over substance
text: A very busy popular bar in the centre of the village. Saturday night was very busy with a long queue outside for entry. IDs were randomly checked. Inside was pretty wedged but you could find a corner to people watch and enjoy the show. Staff were friendly and did well to keep the drinks flowing.

reviews.title: Crews and tangos
text: I usually go to Crews and tangos every Saturday for the drag show. Last night something so weird happened to me. I was making out with a guy and this blonde bartender tapped on my shoulder and said ‚Äúget the fu*k out of here, you‚Äôre straight at a gay bar‚Äù

She was very aggressive. I was like chill I want to order beer. She refused to serve me any alcohol even tho she was serving everybody else. Then she called security for us to kick us out. We explained what she said and the bouncers were pretty understanding. I still can‚Äôt believe how rude she is tho. She has issues for sure. Very hateful In a supposedly loving and accepting place.

reviews.title: Fun Place
text: It is a really cool bar on the Church street. Ground floor is taken by Drag Queens. Lots of dancing on the second floor. Really mixed and fun crowd all over.

reviews.title: So Much Fun!
text: I am absolutely astonished to read so many negative reviews about Crews & Tangos on here-- my friends and I went here last week during our Spring Break in Toronto, and we had a blast! The drag queens were extremely entertaining (i.e. excellent dancers, told hilarious jokes, interacted with the crowd, etc.), the bar staff were extremely friendly (the guy at the bar knew my drink order by the end of the night), and, contrary to what many people have said on here, my friends and I had no issues with the security guards on duty whatsoever-- all they really did were check people's bags, which I personally don't have a problem with. Also, everyone who my friends and I met in here was super friendly and welcoming! In short, our visit to Crews & Tangos was probably our favorite thing we did while in Toronto, and we would gladly go back!

reviews.title: Leave Before 11:00
text: Arrived just after they opened. Very unfriendly.  I believe all the negative reviews about their security people.  And, the place is very dingy and smells awful.  Decided to stick it out a bit longer and glad we did.  The drag queens were tops.  Funny, engaging and very talented performers.  This place is a pit but the drag queens, the real reason to visit the place, were terrific.  Unfortunately, just before 11:00, many more ‚Äúpatrons‚Äù arrived.  Too many drunk/stoned weirdos, so had to leave.

reviews.title: Security way over the top
text: Never going again. Security kills the fun vibe. I was frisked without being informed or asked, we were threatened while standing in line by guy doing ID at the door, and while inside various security guards came across as overbearing, pushy, and power hungry. Seems like a strange match - fun, gay bar meets border patrol/customs airport security. Chill out Crews and Tangos. Gay community: NEVER GO HERE

reviews.title: Terrible and transphobic!
text: they didn't let my girlfriend in because she's a transsexual. very rude staff! stay away from this place!

reviews.title: Terrible place to go
text: If you want to be mistreated by those security animals...go then!! They are horrible people!! Disgusting!!! Any more words to describe them? Pricks maybe...?

They are so rude and have no manners...and how to tell someone they have no manners? You will be kicked out because they think they know what they are doing and they thing they are really something and important at their job. I don't think they have been to school really...to be honest!!
So, avoid that place. Also the place is so old and dated that really make you scared going at the top floor...feels like everything is going to fall apart...scaaarrrrryyyyy!!!!

reviews.title: Thanks Crews and Tangos for the BEST Bachelorette Party Ever
text: AMAZING!!!!! What a super fun unique place. We wanted something out of the ordinary for my Sister In Law to be's bachelorette and let me tell you it was Extraordinary. The cover was cheap, the staff was super friendly and the Performers were superb. Drinks were reasonable and it had a little something for everyone. Loved the different dance floors and partying at the stage with the interactive performances. One of the best nights out I have ever had!!!!! For 8 straight girls looking for a great night we were welcomed with open arms. WE all will definitly be revisiting this Toronto GEM

reviews.title: A small spot with lots of personality
text: My gal pals and I had a great evening here. We enjoyed the shows and choices of music on the dance floors.
Not overly crowded but not dead either. We'll be back!

reviews.title: Let your hair down and have fun, fun, fun
text: Crews and Tango is the best place on Church St. in the Village to have a good time.  Gay or straight.

reviews.title: TERRIBLE ! avoid the dive !
text: Dirty, smelly, rude and unfriendly staff, overpriced drinks, that place is disgusting !
Its clearly falling apart - What to say if not : AVOID that Dive ! Seriously, who trains these people !?
The drag queens show is lame is straight out of the 70ies ! - If I wanted a Museum of Horrors, I would have picked no another place !
Stay away from that place !!

reviews.title: No entry for me.
text: I was there some time after midnight on a Saturday.  There was a queue, but it was moving pretty fast.  When it was my turn to go in, the security guy said "I'll pat you down, ok?"  I agreed.  I showed him my passport.  He looked at it and said "Sorry, I can't let you in, you're too intoxicated."  I don't drink, so he was wrong/full of crap.  He asked me to get off the steps leading to the door.  I did, and asked if they didn't have a breathaliser - I don't know if it's a common thing in Canada, but I've seen some bars here that have it.  Another guy, who might have been a manager or the owner, said "This is a private property, I have the choice to not let you in."  The end.

reviews.title: horrible
text: i went there and the staff and security are very rude the people who work there are only nice to the ones that they know the drag show consist of all of them being all on cocaine the bartenders are not very nice at all they really need to work on their people skills

reviews.title: The Place to START your Night
text: Crews & Tangos is a great place to start your night off with some casula drinking and watching the Drag shows, however it gets full really quick past 11 so its time to move on to a nightclub with more room to dance. The Drag queens are wonderful including Ivory Towers, Heroine Marks, and Daytona B!tch.

reviews.title: Run By Thieves!
text: If you'd like your money stolen by the owner and his precious daughter, then go here.

The bartender upstairs who is the owners daughter STEALS MONEY from customers!!!! DO NOT GO HERE! The owner kicked me out for calling her out and I was not even drinking alcohol. I ORDERED A REDBULL with a twenty dollar bill and got 3 dollars back. BE WARNED! Owner also refused to talk to me about the issue and completely just kicked me out. This place is run by CROOKS!

reviews.title: Not a clean establishment!
text: Tap beer taste horrible and beer taste even worst in those plastic glasses !
The configuration of the stage is horrible and there's no seating to watch the drag show ! This establishment is extremely dirty and run down .
Horrible experience ! I highly recommend not to go

reviews.title: my friend birthday
text: the show was good....we ordered  2 drinks  and cost us $25  we were very surprised....our 2 nd drinks we went to a different bartender she charged us $15 and change  my husband ask why the other guy charged us $25 ??  my husband went to talk to the first bartender and told him he over charged us he denied it  we request a manager ..he talked with the bartender  drop a $10 on the bar in a front of us and didn't say 1 word !!!!!!!!!!!!!!! and a face that I will remember !!!  no class !!!!!!!!!!!  he should be worry about the clients not party with them !!!!!! and the place need some reno and JAVEX !!!!! first time last time !!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.title: Bachelorette party
text: First and last show. Interesting experience for a Bachelorette party. For the additional $15/person it cost to sit right next to the stage, it wasn‚Äôt worth it. There were some balloons and party stuff, but not worth the extra money, would have rather just paid the $5 cover charge. Yes, they brought the Bride up on stage, but it wasn‚Äôt a big deal. There was a good selection of music for the show, but it wasn‚Äôt really funny or humorous at all. Bathrooms in basement run down and very smelly. We only stayed a little over an hour. Pick something else to do for the Bride‚Äôs last fling!

reviews.title: Night Out
text: I decided to go here for my bachelorette and by the end of it wish I hadn't. ( ended up going somewhere else around 12 am ) The place was fun at first but the customer service here was just terrible ( the servers and bouncers) The bathrooms were disgusting. I was out on the patio with the 20 ladies I brought to this place when I had to use the restroom. When I came back they wouldn't let me back on the patio and told me to wait in a line of 30 people.( the rest of my wedding party and guests were out on the patio) When you bring this many people to a venue you;d think they would treat you with a bit more respect. After this incident I rounded up the crew and left, did not want to give any more money to this dump- -Most definitely won't be back!

reviews.title: Great fun and entertainment
text: So much fun for our friends bachelorette! The entertainment was great - they really put on an amazing show. Lots of areas to dance as well!

reviews.title: Really Fun
text: Nice place with nice people, a lot of fun and amazing drag shows. When I come back to Toronto I will definitely go again.

reviews.title: Fun, Fun and more Fun !!
text: I have been here several times now and I must say it has always been fun ! I can come here mainly to watch the Drag Queen shows which are so entertaining and fun ! Everyone who has went on stage here was always so talented and fun tak watch. This place gets packed kn the weekend ans it ia two floors but I love the second floor where the is a DJ ( on weekends at least) and a nice dance floor . Several bars located on both floors , prices are not the cheapest but I stick to buying things in bottles or cans ! The last few times I was here the cover ranged but mostly 5$ as I remember which is not bad at all. I would definitly recommend this place for a night filled with fun and something very diffrent than your average club/ bar in downtown !

reviews.title: Fun night
text: We had a fun night. Yes the drags are very trashy and over the top and they are very limited in there performing abilities, but still so, they are good entertainment. They have a very sharp tongue and that's very funny to listen to, when they talk to the audience.
They have a cover charge and the drinks were really not good at all they tasted like chlorine.

reviews.title: Great bar & entertainment.
text: Went here for a bachelorette. It was great. The bride had a blast. We reserved a table next to the stage and it was a fantastic price to do so and well worth it. The table came set up with treats and party favours + a feather boa and crown for the bride to be! Loved the interaction with the drag queens and the audience. Brides were pulled on stages and some of the people celebrating birthdays where as well. My only negative point would be that it got super hot inside and we weren't allowed to open the windows. But other wise an awesome night. I would definitely recommend Crews & Tango for a fun night out!

reviews.title: Nasty drag queens
text: Never give a drag queen any coins...I went to this bar and have for over 30 years. I had my last $5 (2 toonies and a loonie) and enjoyed the performer on stage so decided to give it to "her" as appreciation for the show. I went to hand her the coins and she missed the catch. What happened next was unreal....she told the DJ to stop the music, turn on the lights and proceeded to yell at me in front of the entire bar for throwing coins and tried to force me to pick them up. I approached the stage to explain that I meant no disrespect and that was my last $5. Other people had given her $5 bills but coin was a disrespect. He/she kicked the coins off the stage. For over 30 years I took friends and newly coming out people there. I doubt I will be back. In a small gay community like Toronto's, this is really disappointing and pathetic. Moral is don't give coins to drag queens.

reviews.title: Fun place with drag shows
text: This was a very friendly pub with a fun drag show!   The service was good and always easy to get drinks.  Only downside is the funky layout of the place made it hard to see but I would go back!

reviews.title: This is a dump avoid at all cost.
text: First off to begin with the security people there are racist, rude and have no respect for paying customers. They accused me of breaking their broken toilet bowl which I never used and had the nerve to tell me their are security cameras in the washroom what a joke. The glasses at the bar was dirty with lip print on the glass. The place smells like a sewer. This place isn't worth your money or time. Don't waste your  time going there . There are nicer places in Toronto. The female security guard was amazing the other security guards were obnoxious. I can go on and on but if you want to have a real horrible time you can visit this place.

reviews.title: Cold
text: At least welcome your guests instead of, "I need to check your bag."..  Give that a try.  Great drag queens...

reviews.title: Good night
text: I like this bar it‚Äôs a good vibe the outside looks very appealing and the people are very friendly so it‚Äôs worth a visit if you in the area üòâ

reviews.title: Good show
text: We went to the Sunday night show and had a good time. No issues with security. No issues with staff. The audio system could be better but the performers were definitely worth the cost of the $9.25 per corona.

reviews.title: The Worst Bar I've Ever Been To
text: I was so super excited to hit up a Gay Bar upon my arrival in Toronto. I've been to so many gay bars all over the world but none of them come close to being as bad as this one. Here are some of the things that disappointed me.

1) The drag queen ACTUALLY STOPPED MID PERFORMANCE to tell my friends and I to stop dancing unless 'you're gonna tip me real good' I t was mortifying for us to be called out on stage for having a bop. it says a lot about her as a performer that the crowd was paying more attention to our gentle bopping than her routine.

2) The barman told me to my face that he wasn't gonna serve me when there were other (Canadian) customers at the bar as he 'knew' that I wouldn't tip him well because I'm European. I was so insulted as I'd been tipping extremely fairly all my trip.

3) Once the performances were over that floor opened up for dancing. My friend went onto the stage platform and danced there for a while. The boucer (male) came up and tried to escort her gently down but not before letting her dance against him. When I DID THE VERY SAME THING a different (female) bouncer literally ran at me and pushed me with the most extreme force off the platform. It knocked me off the stage and literally everybody in the place was so shocked and asking me was i okay. She seemed unbothered that she had nearly broken my kneck wit her brute force.
I would not go here if you are looking for a fun night or if your'e looking to be treated fairly with dignity and respect.

reviews.title: Violating physical integrity
text: Security guys being abusive and treating people with no respect, pushing people and violating physical  integrity.
The inside worn and overpriced, overall dirty especially toilets.
Better stay away if you want to have a good evening. There are better places in Toronto.

reviews.title: Worst Place I Ever Seen in My Life!
text: Worst Place I Ever Seen in My Life! Please Avoid it!!!! DO NOT GO HERE!
They are OVER CHARGE you! Never give you change. The security there are ridiculous. Kicking out people without any reason!
STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!

reviews.title: Not what I expected
text: Daughter of my friend planned this night out for us girls to celebrate her mom's 50th birthday. Was not sure what to expect. The talent that we saw was very good, especially a taller "queen" (sorry don't remember her stage name). My friend's daughter danced competitively for 13 years and was very impressed with her talent. We left around 11ish as it got too crowded and much too loud for us.
